```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
library(stringr)
library(forcats)
library(knitr)
library(kableExtra) # striping
library(nlme)
library(lme4)

knitr::opts_chunk$set(comment = "", message = FALSE, echo = FALSE)
options(width = 80)
```


```{r load_tidy_data}
dat <- read_csv("../data/ih-trial_results_20171020_tidy.csv")
```

## Characteristics of treatment groups
```{r}
dat %>%
  group_by(treatment) %>% 
  summarise(n = sum(!is.na(age)),
            mean = mean(age),
            median = median(age),
            sd = sd(age),
            min = min(age),
            max = max(age)) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  map_if(is_bare_double, ~round(.x, 2)) %>% 
  as_tibble() %>% 
  kable(caption = "Age")
```

\ 
\ 


```{r}
dat %>%
  group_by(treatment) %>% 
  summarise(male = 100 * mean(sex == "male"),
            n = sum(sex == "male")) %>% 
  ungroup() %>% 
  map_if(is_bare_double, ~round(.x)) %>%
  as_tibble() %>% 
  mutate(male = paste0(n, " (",male, " %)")) %>%
  dplyr::select(-n) %>% 
  kable()


```

## Plot individual animal results

```{r}
ggplot(dat) +
  aes(week, value, group = paste(subject, rep), colour = treatment) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_line(alpha = 0.5) +
  facet_grid(sex ~ treatment) +
  labs(title = "Value vs time by treatment and sex",
       subtitle = "Response great in A than B?",
       x = "Week",
       y = "Value (mg/L)") +
  guides(colour = FALSE)
```

## Statistical model

<small>
```{r}
mod <- lmer(value ~ week + sex + age + (1 | subject), data = dat)
summary(mod)
```
</small>
